original_title: The Constitution and the Labor Union
overview: Shows the relationship of the Constitution to organized labor. Presents the case of Whitaker et al. v. North Carolina, in which a group of unions challenged the constitutionality of a state ban on the closed shop, the union shop, and other union security provisions. Traces the role of the fourteenth amendment in labor struggles.

production_companies.name: Columbia University Center for Mass Communication

title: The Constitution and the Labor Union
